document.discussion_title: First INW Honor Flight of 2016 takes off
document.topic_text: Close First INW Honor Flight of 2016 takes off The First INW Honor Flight of 2016 is taking off on Monday from Spokane International Airport. The Honor Flight takes war veterans on a chartered flight to Washington D.C. to see the memorials created in their honor. Laura Papetti , NWCN 9:17 AM. PDT April 25, 2016 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST SPOKANE, Wash. - The first Inland Northwest Honor Flight of 2016 is set to take off on Monday as hundreds of veterans gather at the Spokane International Airport. The veterans will take off for Washington D. C. around 8:00 a.m. Monday and return on Tuesday evening. There are 21 World War II veterans, 55 Korean War veterans, and 21 Vietnam veterans that will be on the flight. If interested in making a donation to the INW Honor Flight, please visit their website .
